title: Analyzing Student Understanding and Difficulties in Differential Equation Learning: Task-Based Instructional Approach

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of intermediate-level courses in related fields or equivalent experience
context.additional_context: A process analyzing students' conceptual understanding levels and difficulties through classroom observations and individual interviews

learning_goals: Learners can analyze the interpretation of differential equations and mathematical concepts through graphical/numerical methods.
Learners can recognize and overcome cognitive dilemmas (function vs. solution method) in the process of solving differential equations.
Learners can explain the balance between intuitive thinking and mathematical rigor when modeling differential equations.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
